content:
I imagine this PR is going to rot quickly if we're not careful. I'm happy with this, but I think someone more topological should pull the trigger. My main hesitations are:

  • "infinite sum" might be preferred pedagogically to "big operators" to people teaching
  • the PR is big and it's hard to be certain that nothing was dropped

The naming of the file doesn't matter to me; perhaps @Sebastien Gouezel or @Heather Macbeth have opinions?

I'm willing to give @Yaël Dillies the benefit of the doubt on the second one, although I know in the past we've used leancrawler to check this type of thing.
open_locale big_operators has always been confusing to my students
If you have concrete proposals, I will take them.
@Kevin Buzzard, the change here is only the use of big_operators in the import line, not the addition of a locale
Since no one expressed any opinions, I requested @Yaël Dillies back out the renaming change so that it doesn't block the split.
Eric Wieser has marked this topic as resolved.
